intro: Cissus pynaertii, commonly known as the African rock fig, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and tendrils that help it climb. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by edible berries that are often consumed by birds and small mammals. Cissus pynaertii is adapted to rocky and arid environments, making it a hardy species that thrives in well-drained soils. Its ability to grow on rock faces makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in dry climates.
